intro: Cryptantha ambigua f. simulans, commonly known as the mimosa cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
